title.narrative: Dialogue on International Food Security and Gender Writeshop
Dialogue sur la sécurité alimentaire internationale et ateliers de rédaction

description.narrative:
This project will provide funding to the University of Alberta to organize an international dialogue on Enhancing Food Production, Gender Equity, and Nutritional Security in a Changing World in spring 2014 in Edmonton, Alberta. The themes will include sustainable food production, gender and livelihoods, nutrition and health, economics, value chains, and policy.
The project is an initiative of the Canadian International Food Security Research Fund (CIFSRF), established in 2009. CIFSRF is a five-year, CA$62 million program funded by IDRC and Canada's Department of Foreign Affairs, Trade and Development. It aims to solve global problems of food and nutritional insecurity through applied, collaborative, results-oriented research.
To date, CIFSRF has supported 21 large applied agriculture and nutrition research consortia in 20 countries, each with a mix of Canadian and developing-country researchers. These projects are generating promising research results. Many have the potential to be scaled-up, so there is a need to share this knowledge with Canadian and global scientific communities and policymakers.
The 2014 dialogue builds on the success of the 2013 scientific conference at the University of Saskatchewan, which included 10 CIFSRF projects.
In addition to the dialogue, CIFSRF is planning two writeshops to help researchers finalize manuscripts for edited collections and special journal issues. At the writeshops, researchers will: -discuss common themes and organize a collection of manuscripts -conduct a peer review of each manuscript, where other authors give feedback in small group settings -address writing challenges and ideas for improving manuscripts -map out next steps and timelines and -review instructions from the publisher.
